title: Do real holograms exist? Are they invented yet? I'm not talking about VR and augmented reality or some kind of trick. I'm talking about hologram that you can see from any angle (360 degrees), but cannot touch it (like a ghost). - Quora

response.answer_text: Do real holograms exist? Are they invented yet? I'm not talking about VR and augmented reality or some kind of trick. I'm talking about hologram that you can see from any angle (360 degrees), but cannot touch it (like a ghost). Absolutely! I bet you’re hoping for this, right?  However, when you say “can see from any angle” I think you also mean ‘projected’ like in the above. Most holograms look like this:  By Georgy Palpurin ShareBulgaria team - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, File:Holographic autoportrait, Sofia.jpg Now, in the picture above, it doesn’t look that good, but when you see them in person they are amazing - truly 3D, visible from any angle:  Full color holograms exist as well. Of course, because they are flat and hang from a wall, it’s hard to get all the way behind them, so that might not fit your original question. If you are looking for a volumetric display, which you can walk around, which would also mean “you can see from any angle (360 degrees),” then yes, they exist also and have for a while. See below:  By Haggispizza - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, File:VX1 DICOM.jpg They are called volumetric displays. Ok, grumpy rant: people often make up a terms when there’s a perfectly good one already there (not you, you heard it from somewhere). Volumetric 3D displays are usually autostereoscopic, meaning you don’t have to have 3D glasses on (not an HMD, I mean shutter glasses). HMD is what you’re thinking of when you think VR Headset. Anyway - there’s a lot of detail here, check it out: Volumetric display - Wikipedia TLDR; Yes, they exist, but they aren’t really what you’re thinking of; physics still makes it hard. They are called Volumetric Displays.

You mean a “holographic Image”. A hologram is a piece of film that has been properly exposed and developed. A: Yes, but not as everyone wants. It is possible only in a very special room with the hologram wrapped all the way around the outside that is illuminated from outside by the laser. This may help, It’s not in final form: Steve's What is a Hologram Q: Do real holograms exist? Are they invented yet? I'm not talking about VR and augmented reality or some kind of trick. I'm talking about hologram that you can see from any angle (360 degrees), but cannot touch it (like a ghost).

No. Projected holograms do not exist, and so far as is known, they are not possible. There is no known way, even in theory, to project light from a source, then have it reach a point and diverge so that it creates an image visible from all angles, without having some physical object there to make it do so.
If they don’t, I’m not sure what this is supposed to be:  (Youtube) It has something to do with (fingerquote)lasers(/fingerquote).
